history.content:
Alright, so, according to what errors you're getting, you need to confirm that you're inputting column vectors for c & b, as the first stage; so for instance 
c = [[713],
     [712],
     [711]]
Then to check the actual figures, first of all rewrite the equations themselves as 'maximize <some function of $$x$$>' subject to constraints <some function of $$x$$> $$\le$$ <some value> Then you just need to transfer the coefficients from those equations, into the linear algebra presentation of them; for instance, maximize $$713x_1 + 712x_2 + 711x_3$$ subject to the constraints $$371x_1 + 372x_2 + 373x_3 \le 500$$, $$571x_1 + 573x_3 \le 300$$ gives 
c = [[713],
     [712],
     [711]]
A = [[371, 372, 373],
     [571, 0, 573]]
b = [[500],
     [300]]
NB when a coefficient for a particular variable is 'missing' from an equation, it is 0

In Lesson 22 (LP 1: Linear Programming), there are quizzes for parts 15 and 16.  My brain isn't quite working out the solutions, but to make matters worse, there doesn't appear to be a solutions video or even a brief "here's what the answers are if you don't want to try or your brain isn't working" section.

I assume there has to be somebody who has gotten the correct answer and could maybe talk to it a little bit?

Also, I've just realized that the upcoming homework is for the N# lectures... I made the bad assumption of looking at the order in Udacity over the lecture schedule and the L#s come first.
history.subject: Linear Programming conversion quizes
